cause.description:
FightAIDS@Home is the first biomedical distributed computing project ever launched. It is run by the Olson Laboratory at The Scripps Research Institute in La Jolla, California. They provide free software that you download and install. The software uses your computer's idle cycles to assist fundamental research in discovering new drugs, building on our growing knowledge of the structural biology of AIDS.
For more information, and to download and install the software (from the World Community Grid), visit http://fightaidsathome.scripps.edu/
1. Use your computer's "spare time" to assist anti-HIV research at the Scripps Institute
2. At your option, donate your computer's "spare time" to other research projects
3. Send no money! It's your computer's time that's needed.
4. Download the application here: http://fightaidsathome.scripps.edu
5. OPTIONALLY -- Join the "FACEBOOK USERS" team (it's the largest one of Facebook Users -- or any other team you like)
6. OPTIONALLY -- Join the Fight AIDS at Home group on FACEBOOK here: http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=2211627516
7. OPTIONALLY -- Put the CAUSES application prominently on your profile page and recruit more people and their computers
8. OPTIONALLY -- Talk to the computer administrator at your work or school about installing Fight AIDS at Home on all their computers
cause.mission: Use our computers' 'spare time' in anti-HIV medical research
